First and foremost, I would tap into the existing networks of discontent, seeking out those who have been marginalized, exploited, and silenced by the system. I would attend community gatherings, protests, and rallies, listening to the stories of those who have been wronged and amplifying their voices. I would create spaces for people to share their experiences, to vent their frustrations, and to find solidarity with others who share their struggles.

Through grassroots organizing, I would help build a sense of community and shared purpose, fostering an environment where people feel empowered to take action. I would facilitate workshops, teach-ins, and skill-shares, educating people about the injustices of the current system and the benefits of a hierarchical-free society. I would build a robust online presence, using encryption and secure communication channels to protect our activists and organizers from government surveillance and repression.

As our movement grows, I would encourage the formation of affinity groups, decentralized networks of individuals who share a common goal and work together to achieve it.
